FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed quantity of fuel of that type, or a quantity of fuel of that type determined in prescribed manner, for the reporting period and the listed province.

Section.MarginalNote: Net fuel quantity — registered road carrier
Section.Text: The net fuel quantity of a person that is a registered road carrier in respect of a type of fuel for a reporting period of the person, for that type of fuel and for a listed province is the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: used by the person in a specified commercial vehicle in the listed province (unless the fuel is used at a covered facility of the person and the person is a registered emitter) during the reporting period,

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: removed from a supply tank of a specified commercial vehicle of the person at a location in the listed province during the reporting period, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (c)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed quantity of fuel of that type, or a quantity of fuel of that type determined in prescribed manner, for the reporting period and the listed province; and

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: transferred into a supply tank of a specified commercial vehicle of the person at a location in the listed province (unless the location is a covered facility of the person and the person is a registered emitter) during the reporting period, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed quantity of fuel of that type, or a quantity of fuel of that type determined in prescribed manner, for the reporting period and the listed province.

Section.MarginalNote: Annual net fuel adjustment — rail carrier
Section.Text: If, at any time in a particular calendar year, a person is a registered specified rail carrier or registered rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel, the annual net fuel adjustment of the person for the particular calendar year, for that type of fuel and for a listed province is the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: used by the person in a locomotive in the listed province at any time in the particular calendar year when the person is a registered specified rail carrier or registered rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed quantity of fuel of that type, or a quantity of fuel of that type determined in prescribed manner, for the particular calendar year and the listed province; and

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: the total determined for A in section 29 or 31 for a reporting period of the person in the particular calendar year, for that type of fuel and for the listed province, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed quantity of fuel of that type, or a quantity of fuel of that type determined in prescribed manner, for the particular calendar year and the listed province.

Section.Text: If the net fuel quantity, determined under any of sections 28 to 32, of a person for a reporting period, for a type of fuel and for a listed province is a positive amount, the person must pay to Her Majesty in right of Canada a charge in respect of that net fuel quantity and the listed province in the amount determined under section 40. The charge becomes payable on the last day of the reporting period.

If the annual net fuel adjustment, determined under section 33, of a person for a particular calendar year, for that type of fuel and for a listed province is a positive amount, the person must pay to Her Majesty in right of Canada a charge in respect of that annual net fuel adjustment and the listed province in the amount determined under section 40. The charge becomes payable on June 30 of the calendar year following the particular calendar year.

Subsection.Text: If fuel is delivered to a person by another person, an exemption certificate applies in respect of the delivery, for the purposes of this Part, only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate is made in prescribed form containing prescribed information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate includes a declaration by the person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered distributor in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered specified air carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered specified marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered specified rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered emitter and that the fuel is for use at a covered facility of the person,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a registered user in respect of that type of fuel and that the fuel is for use in a non-covered activity,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a farmer, that the location at which the fuel is delivered is a farm, that the fuel is for use exclusively in the operation of eligible farming machinery or of an auxiliary component of eligible farming machinery and that all or substantially all of the fuel is for use in the course of eligible farming activities,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a fisher, that the fuel is for use exclusively in the operation of an eligible fishing vessel and that all or substantially all of the fuel is for use in the course of eligible fishing activities, or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: that the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions and that prescribed circumstances exist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person provides, in a manner satisfactory to the Minister, the certificate in respect of the delivery to the other person; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the other person retains the certificate and indicates to the person, in a manner satisfactory to the Minister, that the delivery is subject to the certificate.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if fuel is delivered to a fisher in a listed province that is not prescribed for the purposes of subparagraph 17(2)(a)(iii.1), an exemption certificate does not apply in respect of the delivery.

Despite subsection (1), if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, an exemption certificate applies, for the purposes of this Part, in respect of a delivery of fuel in accordance with prescribed rules.

If a particular person delivers fuel in a listed province to another person at a particular time, if an exemption certificate applies in respect of the delivery in accordance with subsection 36(1) and if the declaration referred to in paragraph 36(1)(b) is, at the particular time, false, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the other person must pay to Her Majesty in right of Canada a charge in respect of the fuel and the listed province in the amount determined under section 40;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the other person is liable to pay, in addition to any other penalty under this Part, a penalty equal to 25% of the amount of the charge under paragraph (a) payable in respect of the fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the particular person knows, or ought to have known, that the declaration is, at the particular time, false, the particular person and the other person are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable for the payment of the charge in respect of the fuel and the listed province under paragraph (a), the penalty under paragraph (b) and any related interest and penalties.

Subsection.Text: The charge under subsection (1) becomes payable at the particular time referred to in that subsection.

Heading.Label: SUBDIVISION D
Heading.TitleText: Application of Charge in Special Circumstances

Section.MarginalNote: Charge — fuel held on adjustment day

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), every person that holds a quantity of a type of fuel in a listed province at the beginning of an adjustment day must pay to Her Majesty in right of Canada a charge in respect of the fuel and the listed province in the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the amount that would be the amount of a charge in respect of the quantity of the fuel and the listed province determined under section 40 if that charge had become payable on the adjustment day; and
is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: if the adjustment day is commencement day, zero, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: in any other case, the amount that would be the amount of a charge in respect of the quantity of the fuel and the listed province determined under section 40 if that charge had become payable on the day before the adjustment day.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a quantity of fuel held by a person if the fuel was delivered to the person by a registered distributor in respect of that type of fuel and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a registered emitter and the fuel is held at, or is in transit to, a covered facility of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a registered user in respect of that type of fuel and an exemption certificate applies in respect of the delivery in accordance with section 36;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a farmer, the fuel is a qualifying farming fuel, and an exemption certificate applies in respect of the delivery in accordance with section 36; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a fisher, the fuel is a qualifying fishing fuel, and an exemption certificate applies in respect of the delivery in accordance with section 36.

Subsection.Text: The charge under subsection (1) becomes payable on the adjustment day.
A charge under subsection (1) in respect of a quantity of a type of fuel held at the beginning of an adjustment day by a person in a listed province is not payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a registered distributor in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a registered specified air carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a registered specified marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a registered specified rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the fuel is, in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations, designated as ships’ stores for use on board a conveyance of a class prescribed under those regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the charge is less than $1,000.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Requirement to determine quantity of fuel
Subsection.Text: Every person that holds fuel (other than in a supply tank of a vehicle) in a listed province at the beginning of an adjustment day and that is, or that can reasonably be expected to be, liable to pay a charge under this section in respect of the fuel and the listed province must determine the quantity of fuel of that type held in the listed province by that person at the beginning of the adjustment day.

If a person holds, at a particular time, a quantity of a type of fuel in a listed province, if the person was immediately before the particular time registered as a distributor, specified air carrier, specified marine carrier or specified rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel and if the Minister cancels that registration at the particular time, the person must pay to Her Majesty in right of Canada a charge in respect of the fuel and the listed province in the amount determined under section 40, unless the Minister also registers the person at the particular time as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a distributor in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to fuel that is held by the person referred to in that subsection if that person is a registered emitter at the particular time but only to the extent that the fuel is, at the particular time, held by the person at, or is in transit to, a covered facility of the person.
The charge under subsection (1) becomes payable at the particular time referred to in that subsection.
The amount of a charge payable under this Division (other than section 38) in respect of fuel and a listed province is equal to the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: if the charge becomes payable under section 34, the net fuel quantity,

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: if the charge becomes payable under section 35, the annual net fuel adjustment, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (c)
FormulaParagraph.Text: in any other case, the quantity of the fuel in respect of which the charge becomes payable; and

FormulaDefinition.Text: is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: if the charge becomes payable under section 35, the rate in respect of fuel of that type for the listed province applicable on December 31 of the calendar year that precedes the calendar year that includes the time at which the charge becomes payable, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: in any other case, the rate in respect of fuel of that type for the listed province applicable at the time the charge becomes payable.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if a manner is prescribed in respect of a mixture that is deemed to be fuel of a prescribed type under subsection 16(2), the amount of a charge payable under this Division in respect of such a mixture is equal to the amount determined in prescribed manner.

Despite subsection (1), if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the amount of a charge payable under this Division in respect of fuel and a listed province is equal to the amount determined in prescribed manner.
The amount of a charge payable under section 25 in respect of combustible waste and a listed province is equal to the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the quantity, expressed as a weight measured in tonnes, of the combustible waste; and
is the rate in respect of combustible waste for the listed province applicable at the time the charge becomes payable.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the amount of a charge payable in respect of combustible waste and a listed province is equal to the amount determined in prescribed manner.

Section.Text: Except as specifically provided under this Part, the Customs Act or the Financial Administration Act, no person has a right to recover any money paid to Her Majesty in right of Canada as or on account of, or that has been taken into account by Her Majesty in right of Canada as, an amount payable under this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Rebate — fuel removed from listed province

Subsection.Text: If at a particular time a person that is a registered emitter or is, in respect of that type of fuel, a registered user, a registered importer, registered air carrier, registered marine carrier or registered rail carrier removes a quantity of fuel of that type from a listed province, the Minister must pay to the person a rebate in respect of the quantity of fuel, the listed province and the reporting period of the person that includes the particular time if, at an earlier time in a particular reporting period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person brought the quantity of fuel into the listed province from a place in Canada or imported the fuel at a location in the listed province, a charge under section 19 or 20 was payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the fuel and the listed province and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under section 19 or subsection 20(2), that charge was taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under subsection 20(3), that charge was paid in accordance with subsection 20(4);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person removed the quantity of fuel from a covered facility of the person in the listed province and a charge under subsection 22(1) or (2)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: became payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of fuel was held by the person at, or the quantity of fuel was in transit to, a facility or property of the person in the listed province that ceased, at the earlier time, to be a covered facility of the person and a charge under subsection 22(4) or (5)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: became payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the rebate under subsection (1) is equal to the amount of the charge referred to in whichever of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Rebate — fuel brought to covered facility

Subsection.Text: If at a particular time a person is a registered emitter and brings a quantity of fuel to a covered facility of the person in a listed province for use at a covered facility of the person in the listed province, the Minister must pay to the person a rebate in respect of the fuel, the listed province and the reporting period of the person that includes the particular time if, at an earlier time in a particular reporting period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person brought the quantity of fuel into the listed province from a place in Canada or imported the fuel at a location in the listed province, a charge under section 19 or 20 was payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under section 19 or subsection 20(2), that charge was taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under subsection 20(3), the charge was paid in accordance with subsection 20(4);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person removed the quantity of fuel from a covered facility of the person in the listed province, a charge under subsection 22(1) or (2) was payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province and that charge was taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of fuel was held by the person at, or the quantity of fuel was in transit to, a facility or property of the person in the listed province that ceased, at the earlier time, to be a covered facility of the person and a charge under subsection 22(4) or (5)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: became payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the rebate under subsection (1) is equal to the amount of the charge referred to in whichever of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Rebate — fuel used in non-covered activity

Subsection.Text: If a person, at a particular time in a reporting period of the person, is a registered user in respect of a type of fuel and the person uses a quantity of fuel of that type in a non-covered activity in a listed province, the Minister must pay to the person a rebate in respect of the fuel, the listed province and the reporting period if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person, at an earlier time in a particular reporting period of the person, brought the quantity of fuel into the listed province from a place in Canada or imported the fuel at a location in the listed province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a charge under section 19 or 20 was payable by the person at the earlier time in respect of the quantity of fuel and the listed province and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under section 19 or subsection 20(2), that charge was taken into account in the determination of the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if that charge was payable under subsection 20(3), the charge was paid in accordance with subsection 20(4); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the fuel is used at a location that is not a covered facility of the person.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the rebate under subsection (1) is equal to the amount of the charge referred to in paragraph (1)(b).

If a net fuel quantity, determined under any of sections 28 to 32, of a person for a reporting period, for a type of fuel and for a listed province is a negative amount, the Minister must pay to the person a rebate in respect of that net fuel quantity, the listed province and the reporting period.
The amount of a rebate payable under subsection (1) is equal to the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the net fuel quantity referred to in that subsection; and
is the rate in respect of fuel of that type for the listed province applicable on the last day of the reporting period referred to in that subsection.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the amount of a rebate payable under this section is equal to the amount determined in prescribed manner.

If an annual net fuel adjustment of a person, determined under section 33, for a calendar year, for a type of fuel and for a listed province is a negative amount, the Minister must pay to the person a rebate in respect of that annual net fuel adjustment and the listed province.
The amount of a rebate payable under subsection (1) is equal to the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the annual net fuel adjustment referred to in that subsection; and
is the rate in respect of fuel of that type for the listed province applicable on December 31 of the calendar year referred to in that subsection.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the amount of a rebate payable under this section is equal to the amount determined in prescribed manner.

Section.Text: The Minister must pay a rebate in respect of fuel or combustible waste and a listed province to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions in the amount determined in prescribed manner if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must pay a rebate to a person if the person paid an amount in excess of the amount that was payable by that person under this Part whether the amount was paid by mistake or otherwise.
The amount of a rebate payable under subsection (1) by the Minister is the amount of the excess referred to in that subsection.
A rebate under this section in respect of an amount must not be paid to a person to the extent that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount was taken into account as an amount required to be paid by the person in respect of a reporting period of the person and the Minister has assessed the person for that period under section 108; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount was an amount assessed under section 108.

Subsection.Text: Despite any other provision under this Part, a rebate under this section in respect of an amount is not to be paid to a person unless an application for the rebate is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made in prescribed form containing prescribed information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: filed with the Minister in prescribed manner within two years after the earlier of the day that the amount was taken into account in determining the net charge for a reporting period of the person and the day that the amount was paid to the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: Not more than one application for a rebate under this section may be made by a person in a calendar month.

Section.Text: A rebate is not to be paid to a person under this Division

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the extent that it can reasonably be regarded that the person has obtained or is entitled to obtain a rebate, refund or remission of the amount under any other section of this Act or under any other Act of Parliament; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Section.Text: A rebate under this Division is not to be paid to a person at any time unless all returns of which the Minister has knowledge and that are required to be filed at or before that time by the person under this Part, the Excise Tax Act, the Income Tax Act, the Excise Act, 2001 and the Air Travellers Security Charge Act have been filed with the Minister.

Despite any other provision under this Part, a rebate under this Division, other than section 49, in respect of a particular reporting period of a person is not to be paid unless an application for the rebate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is made in prescribed form containing prescribed information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (c) applies, is filed with the Minister in prescribed manner

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on or before the day on or before which the return under section 69 is required to be filed for the last reporting period of the person that ends within two years after the end of the particular reporting period, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the return in respect of the reporting period in which the amount of the rebate is taken into account in determining the net charge for the reporting period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the rebate is payable under section 47 in respect of an annual net fuel adjustment for a particular calendar year, is filed with the Minister in prescribed manner

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on or before the day on which the return under section 69 is required to be filed for the reporting period of the person that includes June 30 of the year following the particular calendar year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the return in respect of the reporting period that includes June 30 of the year following the particular calendar year.

Section.Text: Only one application may be made under this Division for a rebate with respect to any matter.

If a trustee is appointed under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act to act in the administration of the estate or succession of a bankrupt, a rebate under this Part that the bankrupt was entitled to claim before the appointment must not be paid after the appointment unless all returns required under this Part, the Excise Tax Act, the Income Tax Act, the Excise Act, 2001 and the Air Travellers Security Charge Act to be filed for reporting periods of the bankrupt ending before the appointment have been filed and all amounts required under this Part, the Excise Tax Act, the Income Tax Act, the Excise Act, 2001 and the Air Travellers Security Charge Act to be paid by the bankrupt in respect of those reporting periods have been paid.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 4
Heading.TitleText: Registration, Reporting Periods, Returns and Payments

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as a distributor in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: both marketable natural gas and non-marketable natural gas, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person produces marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas in a listed province,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person imports marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas at a location in a listed province otherwise than in a supply tank of a vehicle,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person brings marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas into a listed province from a place in Canada otherwise than in a supply tank of a vehicle,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the person delivers marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas to another person in a listed province,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the person measures another person’s consumption or usage, in a listed province, of marketable natural gas and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the measurement is done on a regular basis and for the purpose of billing the other person or providing the other person’s billing information to a third party, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the marketable natural gas is delivered by way of a distribution system,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a type of fuel other than marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person produces fuel of that type in a listed province,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under subsection (1) to be registered as a distributor in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) or (c) applies, the later of commencement day and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the type of fuel is marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas, the day that is the earliest of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the day on which the person first produces marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas in a listed province,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the day on which the person first imports marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas in a listed province otherwise than in a supply tank of a vehicle,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the day on which the person first brings marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas into a listed province from a place in Canada otherwise than in a supply tank of a vehicle,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the day on which the person first delivers marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas to another person in a listed province, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the day on which the person first measures another person’s consumption or usage of marketable natural gas in a listed province if

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the measurement is for the purpose of billing the other person or providing the other person’s billing information to a third party, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: the marketable natural gas is delivered by way of a distribution system, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the fuel is not marketable natural gas and is not non-marketable natural gas, the day on which the person first produces fuel of that type in a listed province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is a person prescribed under either subparagraph (1)(a)(vi) or (b)(ii), a person of a class prescribed under either of those subparagraphs or a person meeting conditions prescribed under either of those subparagraphs, the prescribed time; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: A person that is not required under subsection (1) to be registered as a distributor in respect of a type of fuel (other than marketable natural gas or non-marketable natural gas) may apply to the Minister to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as a distributor in respect of that type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person carries on the business of selling, delivering or distributing fuel of that type and, in the ordinary course of that business, delivers fuel of that type in a listed province

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to another person for the purpose of resale, in the ordinary course of business, by the other person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered distributor in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a farmer at a farm if the fuel is qualifying farming fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: to a fisher if the fuel is qualifying fishing fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered specified air carrier in respect of that type of fuel if the fuel is qualifying aviation fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered specified marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel if the fuel is qualifying marine fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered specified rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel if the fuel is qualifying rail fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered emitter at a covered facility of the registered emitter,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered user in respect of that type of fuel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: to another person if the fuel is, in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations, designated as ships’ stores for use on board a conveyance of a class prescribed under those regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person carries on the business of selling, delivering or distributing fuel of that type and, in the ordinary course of that business, removes fuel of that type from a listed province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a person in respect of a type of fuel if the person is, or is required to be, registered as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as an importer in respect of a type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person imports fuel of that type — other than fuel that is imported in a supply tank of a vehicle or fuel that is gasoline, kerosene, light fuel oil or propane in a quantity that does not exceed 200 L — at a location in a listed province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person brings fuel of that type — other than fuel that is brought in a supply tank of a vehicle or fuel that is gasoline, kerosene, light fuel oil or propane in a quantity that does not exceed 200 L — into a listed province from a place in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under subsection (1) to be registered as an importer in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) or (c) applies, the later of commencement day and the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the person first imports fuel of that type — other than fuel that is imported in a supply tank of a vehicle or fuel that is gasoline, kerosene, light fuel oil or propane in a quantity that does not exceed 200 L — at a location in a listed province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the person first brings fuel of that type — other than fuel that is brought in a supply tank of a vehicle or fuel that is gasoline, kerosene, light fuel oil or propane in a quantity that does not exceed 200 L — into a listed province from a place in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is a person prescribed under paragraph (1)(c), a person of a class prescribed under that paragraph or a person meeting conditions prescribed under that paragraph, the prescribed time; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: A person that is not required under subsection (1) to be registered as an importer in respect of a type of fuel, may apply to the Minister to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as an importer in respect of that type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is an interjurisdictional rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person, in the ordinary course of a business,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: imports, in a supply tank of a locomotive, fuel of that type at a location in a listed province,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: brings, in a supply tank of a locomotive, fuel of that type into a listed province from a place in Canada, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: removes, in a supply tank of a locomotive, fuel of that type from a listed province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is not required to be registered under Division 4 of this Part, in respect of that type of fuel, as a specified air carrier, an air carrier, a specified marine carrier, a marine carrier, a specified rail carrier or a rail carrier;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a person in respect of a type of fuel if the person is, or is required to be, registered as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a distributor in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: as a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person may apply to the Minister to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as an emitter if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is, for the purposes Part 2, a person responsible for a covered facility and the person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has been issued a covered facility certificate in respect of the covered facility by the Minister of the Environment under section 171, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, in respect of a prescribed facility or property, a facility or property of a prescribed class or a facility or property meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is not registered as a distributor in respect of a type of fuel and is not required to be so registered may apply to the Minister to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as a user in respect of that type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person uses, in the ordinary course of business of the person, fuel of that type in a non-covered activity in a listed province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Section.MarginalNote: User of combustible waste — registration required

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as a user in respect of combustible waste if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person burns combustible waste in a listed province for the purpose of producing heat or energy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under subsection (1) to be registered as a user in respect of combustible waste must apply to the Minister for registration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, before the later of commencement day and the day on which the person first burns combustible waste in a listed province for the purpose of producing heat or energy; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, before the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person (other than a registered emitter) that is an interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying aviation fuel is required to be registered at a particular time for the purposes of this Part

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, as an air carrier in respect of that type of fuel if it can reasonably be expected that, during the calendar year that includes the particular time, all or substantially all of the fuel of that type used by the person will be used in vehicles and the greatest proportion of the fuel used in vehicles will be used in aircraft; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as either a specified air carrier or an air carrier in respect of that type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the calendar year that includes the particular time, all or substantially all of the fuel of that type used by the person is used in vehicles and the greatest proportion of the fuel used in vehicles is used in aircraft, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a qualifying interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of that type of fuel throughout the calendar year that includes the particular time.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Qualifying interjurisdictional air carrier — previous year journeys
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(b)(ii), an interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying aviation fuel is a qualifying interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of fuel of that type throughout a particular calendar year if the interjurisdictional air carrier completed journeys by aircraft in the calendar year that preceded the particular calendar year and the amount determined by the following formula is greater than, or equal to, 0.5:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that was used by the interjurisdictional air carrier in an excluded air journey during the preceding calendar year; and

is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that was used by the interjurisdictional air carrier in a covered air journey or an excluded air journey during the preceding calendar year.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Qualifying interjurisdictional air carrier — no previous year journeys
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(b)(ii), a person that is, or that can reasonably be expected to be, an interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying aviation fuel is a qualifying interjurisdictional air carrier in respect of fuel of that type throughout a particular calendar year if the person did not complete journeys by aircraft in the calendar year that preceded the particular calendar year and the amount determined by the following formula is greater than, or equal to, 0.5:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that can reasonably be expected to be used by the person in an excluded air journey during the particular calendar year; and

is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that can reasonably be expected to be used by the person in a covered air journey or an excluded air journey during the particular calendar year.

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered for the purposes of this Part

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a specified air carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as an air carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a specified air carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under this section to be registered as a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, before the later of commencement day and the day that the person first meets the conditions under subsection (1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, before the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person (other than a registered emitter) that is an interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying marine fuel is required to be registered at a particular time for the purposes of this Part

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, as a marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel if it can reasonably be expected that, during the calendar year that includes the particular time, all or substantially all of the fuel of that type used by the person will be used in vehicles and the greatest proportion of the fuel used in vehicles will be used in vessels; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as either a specified marine carrier or a marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the calendar year that includes the particular time, all or substantially all of the fuel of that type used by the person is used in vehicles and the greatest proportion of the fuel used in vehicles is used in vessels, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a qualifying interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel throughout the calendar year that includes the particular time.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Qualifying interjurisdictional marine carrier — previous year journeys
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(b)(ii), an interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying marine fuel is a qualifying interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel throughout a particular calendar year if the interjurisdictional marine carrier completed journeys by vessel in the calendar year that preceded the particular calendar year and the amount determined by the following formula is greater than, or equal to, 0.5:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is used by the interjurisdictional marine carrier in an excluded marine journey during the preceding calendar year; and

is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that is used by the interjurisdictional marine carrier in a covered marine journey or an excluded marine journey during the preceding calendar year.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Qualifying interjurisdictional marine carrier — no previous year journeys
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(b)(ii), a person that is, or that can reasonably be expected to be, an interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying marine fuel is a qualifying interjurisdictional marine carrier in respect of fuel of that type throughout a particular calendar year if the person did not complete journeys by vessel in the calendar year that preceded the particular calendar year and the amount determined by the following formula is greater than, or equal to, 0.5:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that can reasonably be expected to be used by the person in an excluded marine journey during the particular calendar year; and

is the total of all quantities, each of which is a quantity of fuel of that type that can reasonably be expected to be used by the person in a covered marine journey or an excluded marine journey during the particular calendar year.

Paragraph.Label: (a)

Paragraph.Text: as a marine carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under this section to be registered as a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, before the later of commencement day and the day that the person first meets the conditions under subsection (1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, before the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person (other than a registered emitter) that is an interjurisdictional rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying rail fuel is required to be registered at a particular time for the purposes of this Part, if it can reasonably be expected that, during the calendar year that includes the particular time, all or substantially all of the fuel of that type used by the person will be used in vehicles and the greatest proportion of the fuel used in vehicles will be used in locomotives

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, as a rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as either a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel if the interjurisdictional rail carrier is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions.

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered for the purposes of this Part

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a specified rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as a rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person may apply to the Minister to be registered for the purposes of this Part

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a specified rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as a rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under this section to be registered as a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, before the later of commencement day and the day that the person first meets the conditions under subsection (1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, before the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered, for the purposes of this Part, as a road carrier in respect of a type of fuel that is a qualifying motive fuel if the person uses fuel of that type in a specified commercial vehicle in a listed province unless the person is, or is required to be, registered, for the purposes of this Part as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a distributor in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel.

Subsection.Text: A person is required to be registered for the purposes of this Part as a road carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person may apply to the Minister to be registered for the purposes of this Part as a road carrier in respect of a type of fuel if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required under this section to be registered as a road carrier in respect of a type of fuel must apply to the Minister for registration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) applies, before the later of commencement day and the day on which the person first uses fuel of that type in a specified commercial vehicle in a listed province; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, before the prescribed time.

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: An application for registration under this Division is to be made in prescribed form containing prescribed information and is to be filed with the Minister in prescribed manner.

The Minister may register any person that applies for registration and, if the Minister does so, the Minister must notify the person of the registration number assigned to the person for the purposes of this Part and of the effective date of the registration.

The Minister may, after giving a person that is registered under this Division reasonable written notice, cancel a registration of the person under this Division if the Minister is satisfied that the registration is not required for the purposes of this Part.

If a person files with the Minister in prescribed manner a request, in prescribed form containing prescribed information, to have a registration of the person cancelled, the Minister must cancel the registration of the person if the Minister is satisfied that the registration is not required for the purposes of this Part.
The Minister must cancel a registration of a person under this Division in prescribed circumstances.
If the Minister cancels a registration of a person under this Division, the Minister must notify the person of the cancellation and the effective date of the cancellation.
If a person is registered as a distributor in respect of a type of fuel, the Minister must cancel that registration when registering the person as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel.

Subsection.Text: If a person is registered as an importer in respect of a type of fuel, the Minister must cancel that registration when registering the person as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a distributor in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an emitter; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a user in respect of that type of fuel.

Subsection.Text: If a person is registered as a user in respect of a type of fuel, the Minister must cancel that registration when registering the person as a distributor in respect of that type of fuel.
If a person is registered as a road carrier in respect of a type of fuel, the Minister must cancel that registration when registering the person as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a distributor in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel.

Subsection.Text: If a person is registered, in respect of a type of fuel, as a specified air carrier, an air carrier, a specified marine carrier, a marine carrier, a specified rail carrier or a rail carrier, the Minister must, unless prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, cancel whichever of those registrations applies when registering the person as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a specified air carrier or air carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a specified marine carrier or marine carrier in respect of that type of fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a specified rail carrier or rail carrier in respect of that type of fuel; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an emitter.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, the Minister may require a person that applies to be registered, or that is required to be registered, under this Division to give and maintain security, in an amount determined by the Minister and subject to any terms and conditions that the Minister may specify, for the payment of any amount that is or may become payable by the person under this Part.

If, at any time, a person referred to in subsection (1) fails to give or maintain security in an amount satisfactory to the Minister, the Minister may retain as security, out of any amount that may be or may become payable under this Part to the person, an amount not exceeding the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the amount of security that would, at that time, be satisfactory to the Minister if it were given by the person in accordance with subsection (1); and
is the amount of security, if any, given and maintained by the person in accordance with subsection (1).

Subsection.Text: The amount retained under subsection (2) is deemed to have been paid, at the time referred to in that subsection, by the Minister to the person, and to have been given, immediately after that time, by the person as security in accordance with subsection (1).

Section.Text: For greater certainty, a registration issued under this Part is not a statutory instrument for the purposes of the Statutory Instruments Act.

Heading.Label: SUBDIVISION B
Heading.TitleText: Reporting Periods, Returns and Requirement to Pay

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, calendar quarter means a period of three months beginning on the first day of January, April, July or October.
For the purposes of this Part, a reporting period of a person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (b) or (c) applies, a calendar month;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unless paragraph (c) applies, if the person is registered as a road carrier in respect of any type of fuel and is not otherwise registered, or required to be registered, under this Division, a calendar quarter; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed period if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person, a person of a prescribed class or a person meeting prescribed conditions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), if at a particular time the Minister registers a person, or cancels a registration of a person, under this Division

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the particular reporting period of the person that includes the particular time ends on the day that includes the particular time; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a reporting period of the person begins on the day following the day that includes the particular time and ends on the day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: unless subparagraph (ii) applies, the last day of the month that includes the particular time, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the last day of the calendar quarter that includes the particular time if, immediately after the particular time, the person is registered as a road carrier in respect of any type of fuel and is not otherwise registered, or required to be registered, under this Division.

Subsection.Text: Every person that is registered or required to be registered under this Division must file a return with the Minister for each reporting period of the person. The return is to be filed not later than the last day of the first month after the reporting period.

Every person that is not registered and not required to be registered under this Division must file a return with the Minister for each reporting period of the person in which a charge (other than a charge under subsection 20(3)) becomes payable by the person. The return is to be filed not later than the last day of the first month after the reporting period.

If prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, a return for a reporting period that is a prescribed reporting period or a reporting period meeting prescribed conditions must, despite subsections (1) and (2), be filed in accordance with prescribed rules.

If prescribed circumstances exist or prescribed conditions are met, a return for a reporting period that is a prescribed reporting period or a reporting period meeting prescribed conditions, despite subsections (1) and (2), is not required to be filed.

Section.Text: Every return required to be filed under section 69 is to be made in prescribed form containing prescribed information and is to be filed in prescribed manner.

Subsection.Text: Every person that is required to file a return under section 69 must, in the return, determine the net charge for the reporting period of the person for which the return is required to be filed.
Subject to this Part, the net charge for a particular reporting period of a person is the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all amounts, each of which is the amount determined for a listed province by the formula
is the total of all amounts, each of which is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a charge (other than a charge under subsection 20(3)) in respect of fuel and the listed province that becomes payable by the person in the particular reporting period,

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a charge in respect of combustible waste and the listed province that becomes payable by the person in the particular reporting period, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (c)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed amount, or an amount determined in prescribed manner, in respect of the listed province that is required to be added in determining the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person, and

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of all amounts, each of which is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: an amount of a rebate (other than a rebate under section 49 or a net charge rebate under subsection (4)) in respect of the listed province payable by the Minister in respect of a reporting period and that is claimed by the person in the return under section 69 for the particular reporting period, or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a prescribed amount, or an amount determined in prescribed manner, in respect of the listed province that may be deducted in determining the net charge for the particular reporting period of the person; and

FormulaDefinition.Text: the total of all amounts, each of which is a positive or negative prescribed amount, or an amount determined in prescribed manner, for the particular reporting period of the person.

Subsection.Text: If the net charge for a reporting period of a person is a positive amount, the person must pay that amount to the Receiver General on or before the day on or before which the return for the reporting period is required to be filed.

If the net charge for a reporting period of a person is a negative amount, the person may claim in the return filed under section 69 for that reporting period the amount of that net charge as a net charge rebate for the reporting period payable to the person by the Minister. The Minister must pay the net charge rebate to the person with all due dispatch after the return is filed.

The Minister is not required to pay a net charge rebate under subsection (4) to a person unless the Minister is satisfied that all information, that is contact information or that is information relating to the identification and business activities of the person, to be given by the person on any application made by the person under this Division for registration has been provided and is accurate.

If a net charge rebate for a reporting period of a person is paid to the person under subsection (4), interest at the prescribed rate is to be paid to the person on the net charge rebate for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the later of the day the return in which the net charge rebate is claimed is filed with the Minister and the day following the last day of the reporting period and ending on the day the net charge rebate is paid.

Section.Text: If an amount is paid to, or applied to a liability of, a person as a rebate, or as interest, under this Part and the person is not entitled to the rebate or interest, as the case may be, or the amount paid or applied exceeds the rebate or interest, as the case may be, to which the person is entitled, the person must pay to the Receiver General an amount equal to the rebate, interest or excess, as the case may be, on the day the rebate, interest or excess, as the case may be, is paid to, or applied to a liability of, the person.

Subsection.Text: A person that is required to file, under section 69, a return for a reporting period of the person, must report in that return

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount determined for each listed province that is included in the determination of A in the formula in subsection 71(2) for the reporting period of the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an amount that is a prescribed amount or an amount determined in prescribed manner.

Subsection.Text: In addition to any other penalty under this Part, every person that fails to report an amount referred to in subsection (1) when and as required in a return required to be filed under section 69, or that misstates such an amount in the return, is liable to a penalty, for each failure or misstatement, equal to 5% of the absolute value of the difference between the amount and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person failed to report the amount as and when required, zero; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person misstated the amount, the amount that was reported by the person in the return.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: bankrupt has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. (failli)
business includes a part of a business. (entreprise)
receiver means a person that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under the authority of a debenture, bond or other debt security, of a court order or of an Act of Parliament or of the legislature of a province, is empowered to operate or manage a business or a property of another person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is appointed by a trustee under a trust deed in respect of a debt security to exercise the authority of the trustee to manage or operate a business or a property of the debtor under the debt security;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is appointed by a bank or an authorized foreign bank, as those terms are defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, to act as an agent or mandatary of the bank in the exercise of the authority of the bank under subsection 426(3) of that Act in respect of property of another person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is appointed as a liquidator to liquidate the assets of a corporation or to wind up the affairs of a corporation; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is appointed as a committee, guardian, curator, tutor or mandatary in case of incapacity with the authority to manage and care for the affairs and assets of an individual who is incapable of managing those affairs and assets.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It includes a person that is appointed to exercise the authority of a creditor under a debenture, bond or other debt security to operate or manage a business or a property of another person, but, if a person is appointed to exercise the authority of a creditor under a debenture, bond or other debt security to operate or manage a business or a property of another person, it does not include that creditor. (séquestre)

Definition.Text: relevant assets of a receiver means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the receiver’s authority relates to all the properties, businesses, affairs and assets of a person, all those properties, businesses, affairs and assets; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the receiver’s authority relates to only part of the properties, businesses, affairs or assets of a person, that part of the properties, businesses, affairs or assets. (actif pertinent)

Definition.Text: representative means a person, other than a trustee in bankruptcy or a receiver, that is administering, winding up, controlling or otherwise dealing with any property, business, estate or succession of another person. (représentant)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, if on a particular day a person becomes a bankrupt,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the trustee in bankruptcy, and not the person, is liable for the payment of any amount (other than an amount that relates solely to activities in which the person begins to engage on or after the particular day and to which the bankruptcy does not relate) that is required to be paid by the person under this Part, during the period beginning on the day immediately after the day on which the trustee became the trustee in bankruptcy of the person and ending on the day on which the discharge of the trustee is granted under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, except that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the trustee is liable for the payment of any amount that is required to be paid by the person under this Part after the particular day in respect of reporting periods that ended on or before the particular day but only to the extent of the property of the person in possession of the trustee available to satisfy the liability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the trustee is not liable for the payment of any amount for which a receiver is liable under subsection (3), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the payment by the person of an amount in respect of the liability discharges the liability of the trustee to the extent of that amount;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if, on the particular day the person is registered under Division 4 of this Part, the registration continues in relation to the activities of the person to which the bankruptcy relates as though the trustee in bankruptcy were registered under that Division in the same capacity as the person in respect of those activities and ceases to apply to the activities of the person in which the person begins to engage on or after the particular day and to which the bankruptcy does not relate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reporting periods of the person begin and end on the day on which they would have begun and ended if the bankruptcy had not occurred, except that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
